divs: sighting detailsat home on the evening of 11\16\06, i let my dog out into the backyard and since the weather was nice, i went out with him. it was cool, dark and clear out. i saw a light in the sky that was unusually close, and thought it might be a helicopter flying nearby. it was silent, and i waited for the normal engine sound to follow, but it didn't. it flew by slowly at a surprisingly low altitude (like a police helicopter that is looking for someone), with red and green lights, not flashing. i could see no shape at all. while taking this in, i saw a second one, and then a third. i could see that the "lights" were going in a slow circling pattern over about a one-mile diameter area. they would disappear behind the trees and re-emerge. i watched each go by at least two times. while looking at one that had just circled by, it stopped, and started moving toward my home. up to now, i had been feeling curious, but at this point i was scared - it seemed as though it knew i was there. i thought "wtf am i going to do when this thing comes over my home!" at this point, it stopped again, and went back into its "orbit." i quickly got my dog in the house and called the police department to ask what was flying over my neighborhood - the officer didn't know, and he radioed the addison airport (which is about a mile away) to ask. i could hear the officer relay my comments to the controller, who said that nothing had been or was currently on radar and that no planes were, or would be, in a circling flight pattern anywhere. (note: my neighborhood is not in any flight path in or out of the airport.) after the call, i went back outside and the lights were gone. a few minutes later, a couple of police officers stopped by to check this out further. in response to their questions, i confirmed to them i had not been drinking, was not on any medication, etc. i explained what i saw and said i simply wanted to know what the lights were. the officers were apologetic, respectful and i felt they believed me. they said they would keep an eye out for these lights during the remainder of that evening.
